titleStmt.title: The married-mans best potion: or, A new song plainly setting forth the excellency, and incomparable worth of a good wife, as also how much happiness doth continually attend upon that man that enjoys her. To the tune of, Fancies Phœnix.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for W. Thackeray, T. Passenger, and W. Whitwood,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Amongst those worldly joyes, of which".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
